headline.main: U.S. FLIERS DOWN 9 PLANES IN CHINA; Japanese Losses at Hengyang Are Raised to at Least 17 Craft in Two Days AMERICAN AIRMEN SCORE AGAIN IN CHINA U.S. FLIERS DOWN 9 PLANES IN CHINA

lead_paragraph: CHUNGKING, China, Aug. 1 -- United States fighter pilots shot down nine Japanese planes over Hengyang yesterday, raising the Japanese losses over that Hunan Province air base to at least seventeen in two days, Lieut. Gen. Joseph W. Stilwell announced today as the Chinese reported a new Japanese landing on the coast of Chekiang Province.
